Program_Title: President Obama on the Tax Cut Agreement

Headlines:
Join us: http://my.barackobama.com/taxcutvid

President Obama recorded a video to speak directly to OFA supporters about the recent compromise on tax cuts.

Text: hi everybody
one to take a few minutes to talk with you about some steps i just announced to
protect the middle class
create jobs
and give our recovery an added shot a moment
as you probably know
the income tax cuts that were put in place last decade are scheduled to
expire on january first
along with a series of tax cuts for the middle class that we may soon after i
took office
this would all told me in a tax increase of three thousand dollars for the
typical family
and could cost our economy well over a million jobs
at the same time impasse in congress means unemployment insurance would
expire for
two million americans would lose their emergency assistance
right in the middle of the holy see's
it would be eight perfect storm that would set families businesses and our
country back
just as well covering from a devastating recession than a decade of stagnant
wages
to break the logjam
i know she ate it bipartisan discussions
and yesterday i announced a framework for a solution that would head off this
calamity
would bring americans additional tax relief
keep unemployment insurance in place
and provide new incentives for businesses to grow
now i know some folks
even good friends
are unhappy with the plan
because as with any negotiation getting their required some give-and-take
in exchange for a temporary extension of the tax cuts for the wealthiest
americans
were also able to protect key tax cuts for middle-class families
republicans were forced to end their obstruction of an extension of
unemployment insurance
and we secured a payroll tax cut for workers
a tax cut you'll see right in your paycheck worth about dials in dollars
for a typical family
as well as tax breaks for college students and small businesses
i have no doubt that everyone will be able to find something in this
compromise
but they don't like
there things in here that
frankly i don't like
namely the extension the tax cuts for the wealthiest americans
at a time when we need to
focus on bringing down the deficit
but this is not the end of this fight
these tax cuts will expire in two years and i will continue to make the case
to the american people about why i don't believe they should be renewed
in fact i'm confident but as we make the tough choices to cut the deficit
it will become apparent that we can't afford to extend these tax cuts for the
wealthiest americans
one day longer
now i've heard the argument that we should a follow up
that we should
make republicans pay a political price for holding tax cuts for the middle
class hostage
even if it met allowing unemployment insurance to and or taxes to go up on
every american come january first
and even though it was unlikely we could have done as well by waiting for the new

but like i said yesterday
i'm going to make the american people collateral damage to political

i don't play games with the lives of the american people
or jeopardize our economy in order to score political points
that's not what you sent me here
for too long
washington has been a place where any compromise was seen as a failure
where victory was defined not by what you would cheat for the country but
who you defeated in partisan warfare
i ran for president because believed we could before that mentality in the law
we can't afford to fight the same battles over and over again
we can afford another day another year another decade
and which washington is simply defined by rancor and division
i've counted on your support because you understand the importance of changing
our politics
of doing hard work a finding common ground
it's not perfect but this compromise is an essential step on the road to
recovery
it will stop middle-class taxes from going up just as i promised
thoughts for our private sector to create millions of new jobs who had
momentum
that are economy badly needs right now
that's how we define our success
by the positive difference we can make in the lives of our fellow americans
that's why this compromise is the right thing to do
